intro: Echites truncatus, commonly known as the narrowleaf echites, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a low, spreading herb with narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits called cypselae. Echites truncatus is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
